page.title: 14STOW FAIR
page.content: In 1475 the{Abbot of Evesham,}then {Lord of the Manor,}was granted a{Royal {Charter}by Edward IV to hold a fair in May and October. For centuries this was mainly a{sheep fair}held in the Market Square but now it is almost exclusively concerned with{horses and {ponies. The sales are held down the Swell Road while a{fun fair}fills the Square. It is an important occasion in the{Gipsy}calendar, for a great deal of horse-dealing takes place away from the official{auction}rings. On these two occasions the roadside is crowded with{market stalls}selling a wide variety of goods. This does lead to considerable{traffic congestion. Some newcomers to the area would like to see the Fairs subject to much tighter controls, but the locals are quite happy with it the way it is!
